1.q_string: A metro train starts from rest and in 5 s, attains a speed of 108 km/hr. After that, it moves with a constant velocity and comes to rest after travelling 45 metres with uniform retardation. If the total distance travelled is 395 metres, find the total time of travelling.

A body moving with some initial velocity and having uniform acceleration attains a final velocity \(\mathrm{v} \mathrm{m} / \mathrm{s}\) after travelling \(\mathrm{x} \mathrm{m}\). If its final velocity is \(\mathrm{v}=\sqrt{180-7 \mathrm{x}}\), find the acceleration of the body.

A student is standing at a distance of 50 metres from a bus. As soon as the bus begins its motion with an acceleration of 1 ms-2, the student starts running towards the bus with a uniform velocity 'u'. Assuming the motion to be along a straight road, calculate the minimum value of 'u' so that the student is able to catch the bus.
An automobile travelling with a speed of 60 km/hr can stop within a distance of 20 m. If a car travels twice as fast, i.e. 120 km/hr, then the automobile will stop within a distance of:
A person travels along a straight road for the first half time with a velocity v1 and for the second half time with a velocity v2. The mean velocity 'V' is given by:

A 175 m long train is travelling along a straight track with a velocity of 72 km/h. A bird is flying parallel to the train in the opposite direction with a velocity of 18 km/h. The time taken by the bird to cross the train is:

From the top of a building \(80 \mathrm{~m}\) high, a ball is thrown horizontally which hits the ground at a distance. The line joining the top of the building to the point where it hits the ground makes an angle of \(45^{\circ}\) with the ground. Initial velocity of projection of the ball is \(\left(\mathrm{g}=10 \mathrm{~m} / \mathrm{s}^{2}\right)\)
A particle experiences constant acceleration for 20 s after starting from rest. If it travels a distance s1 in the first 10 seconds and distance s2 in the next 10 seconds, then:

Three particles 'A', 'B' and 'C' are thrown from the top of a tower with the same speed. 'A' is thrown up, 'B' is thrown down and 'C' is thrown horizontally. If they hit the ground respectively with speeds 'VA', 'VB', and 'VC', then:

A particle experiences constant acceleration for 6 seconds after starting from rest. It travels a distance S1 in the first 2 seconds, a distance S2 in the next 2 seconds and a distance S3 in the last 2 seconds. Then, S1 : S2 : S3 will be equal to:

The displacement \(\mathrm{x}\) of a particle moving along a straight line at time \(\mathrm{t}\) is given by \(\mathrm{x}=\) \(\mathrm{a}_{0}+\mathrm{a}_{1} \mathrm{t}+\mathrm{a}_{2} \mathrm{t}^{2}\). What is the acceleration of the particle?
A bullet is fired into a fixed wooden block and it loses half of its velocity after penetrating 40 cm. It comes to rest after penetrating a further distance of:

A balloon is rising vertically upwards with a velocity of 29 ms-1. A stone is dropped from it, which reaches the ground in 10 seconds. The height of the balloon when the stone was dropped from it is (g = 9.8 ms-1):

A car moving at a speed v is stopped after a certain distance when the brakes produce a deceleration a. If the speed of the car is nv, what must be the deceleration of the car to stop it in the same distance and in the same time?
When an object moves an equal distance in equal intervals of time, its motion is said to be:
Which of the following is an example of three dimensional motion?
q_option: Motion of a train on a straight railway track
Motion of a billiard ball on the billiard table

1.q_string: Displacement is a:
An object is said to be in uniform motion in a straight line if its displacement
q_option: Is equal in not equal intervals of time.
Is decreasing in equal intervals of time
Is equal in equal intervals of time.
Is increasing in equal intervals of time

1.q_string: Average velocity is defined as:
q_option: The change in position or displacement (Δx) divided by the time intervals (Δt), in which the displacement occurs
The change in path length (Δx) divided by the time intervals (Δt), in which the displacement occurs
The change in average distance from origin (Δx) divided by the time intervals (Δt), in which the displacement occurs
The change in average path length (Δx) divided by the time intervals (Δt), in which the displacement occurs
